results.title: Noise TV - Darebin Music Feast
results.brief_description:
In this episode of Noise TV we join host Shane Laffy, who introduces us to Mayor Vince Fontana for the opening of the Darebin Music Feast, a community celebration inviting and encouraging us to participate in finding expression through the arts, sharing and benefiting from the diverse cultural experiences that enrich our very own continually developing and unique Australian style and identity.
Featuring an original music score by composer Simon Moore with TheNoise performers and performances on this show include, quirky street horn players, Five Angry Men, the infectious dance drum rythms of the Tumbarumba Samba School & Latin Soulfire Dancers, the amazing Soukous Ba Congo,featuring the soulful vocals of King Bell, Kurdish expert instrumentalist Dursam Akar, a tribute concert for pioneer Greek composer Thymios Stathoulopoulos, featuring vocals from mother and daughter Yiota and Maria Stathoulopoulos, and the ever popular sound of Janine Marshall and Neil Robe.

results.title: Noise pollution
results.brief_description: Combines physics, biology and meteorology to study the effects of noise as impairment to the ear, psychological harm to the individual, physical damage to structures and changes in ecology.

results.title: NOISE on film: noise for Darfur = Why should Australians make noise for Darfur?
results.creator_credit: Darfur Australia Network and Infinite Films
results.brief_description:
This documentary has been produced to raise awareness about the continuing tragedy in the Darfur region of Western Sudan and build solidarity between the Australian people and the people of Darfur.
The conflict in Darfur has been continuing for more than three years, has resulted in the deaths of more than 400,000 civilians, the displacement of at least 2.5 million people and there are currently 3.5 million people dependent upon insufficient international humanitarian aid. Darfur is in crisis and the genocide has to stop.
The film includes footage from refugee camps in Darfur, artwork and music from a range of local artists, and the perceptions of a range of influential Australians as to why Australians should make NOISE for Darfur.

results.title: Noise not sound
results.brief_description: Distinguishes between natural sounds of the environment and excessive, harmful sounds made by humans. Defines sound pollution, tracing historical background, scientific experimentaiton and solutions to sound pollution. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Noise annoys
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Humorous look at the problem of excessive noise levels in an average Australian suburban street. One day the noise becomes too much for God and He intervenes. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Noise [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Christopher Benz, Louise Gartland and Sentinel Films
results.brief_description: A noisy street sweeper hinders the sleep of a man lying in bed. Add to the mix a noisy car reverse parallel parking and the ensuing car alarm as strangers become friends in their unity to stop the noise.

results.title: Noise
results.creator_credit: Don Dickerson and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: Raises such questions as: What is the difference between sound and noise? How does noise effect the individual? As the tempo of urban life increases, must the amount of noise also increase? Explores the effect of noise on the daily activities of a family at home, at school, at work, and indicates ways to control noise. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Noir et blanc
results.creator_credit: Claire Devers, Ministère Français de la Culture and Les Films du Volcan
results.brief_description: A shy, world-weary accountant at a health club takes the advice of his employer to have a massage to relieve tension. The man, white and married, begins regular sessions with a taciturn black masseur, and a sadomasochistic relationship quickly develops between the two men. The accountant’s self-revelatory discovery of masochistic pleasure draws him ever more deeply into a world of pain and humiliation, inflicted in an atmosphere of sinister ritual and silent desire. Shot in black-and-white this understated and compelling film offers an oblique look at the cruel complexities of male relationships. Winner of the Camera d’Or at the 1986 Cannes film festival for best first feature, Devers’ film is based on the short story “Desire and the Black Masseur” by Tennessee Williams. Cast includes Francis Frappat, Jacques Martial, Josephine Fresson and Marc Berman. Written by Claire Devers. Photography by Daniel Desbois, Christopher Doyle, Alain Lasfargues and Jean-Paul de Costa. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Noir
results.brief_description: The collaborative cut-out animation humourously puts a spin on an iconographical film noir scene - the chase. In a dark and deserted building a man (also dark) with his violin and limp follows a lone woman through the floors. Tension builds and eventually the mysterious figure is jumped by the woman who grabs his violin. A fight ensues with the turn throwing of a range of instruments at each other; a violin, tuba, piano all with accompanying foley. No credits provided.

results.title: Noi Tre
results.creator_credit: Pupi Avati, Antonio Avati, Rai Uno Radiotelevisione Italiana, Duea Film and Istituto Luce Italnoleggio Cinematografico
results.brief_description: One of the most delightful films ever made about Mozart, “Noi Tre” is also a delicate and touching study of the last moments of childhood, as the 14 year old prodigy spends summer with his father on Count Pallavicini’s estate preparing for an important exam at the Bologna Philharmonic Academy. However, in between his studies he falls in with the local boys of his own age, and also feels the first stirring’s of love for Antonia, a girl from a nearby villa. Tasting for the first time, the life of a normal 14 year old, Mozart decides to fail the exam.
